alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Outflow from thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Wicomico and northeastern Worcester Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow from thunderstorms over Cape Isle Of Wight, or near Ocean City, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. The outflow will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Wicomico and northeastern Worcester Counties, including the following locations... Bishop, West Ocean City, Ocean City Municipality, Bishopville, Ironshire, Showell, Whaleyville, Willards and Pittsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
